more_content:
The time of year to celebrate fantasy, mystery and imagination is here. And with it comes a mix of parades, scavenger hunts, creepy history and lots, and lots of candy. Halloween in New York City is an affair to remember. Mark your calendar for these events, both for families and adults.

Parades

Village Halloween Parade
October 31, 2018 from 7pm to 10:30pm
The ultimate Halloween parade takes place in Greenwich Village every year. For the past 45 years, people of all ages have gathered to show off their unique, creative and insanely intricate costumes. The event is 100% family friendly. It takes place from 6th Avenue North of Spring Street to 16th Street.

Halloween Dog Costume Contest
October 28, 2018 from 11am to 3pm
As the name suggests, dog owners refuse to let kids have all the fun. Considering that the past decade or so has seen an increase in pet-related events, it’s no wonder that the Halloween industry has found ways to accommodate pet owners. Head to Washington Square Park to see cute and original dog Halloween costumes.

On this note, the New York Hotel is proud to welcome guests with dogs and cats. Read about what to do with your pet in New York.

Halloween-Themed Events

The Amazing Manhattan Halloween Scavenger Hunt
October 31, 2018, starting at 6:30pm
If you want to do something different with your family or friends, sign up for a fun day of running around Manhattan on a Halloween quest. Each ticket costs $39 and includes access to an app that will guide you through the hunt. Every participating member gets a special gift bag!

Halloween Pumpkin Flotilla at Central Park
October 28, 2018 from 4pm to 7pm
By the end of October, Central Park will be the quintessential fall foliage attraction in NYC, but Halloween will be a special time to visit. The famous pumpkin flotilla is comprised of carved jack-o-lanterns floating around. The event also includes pumpkin carving, storytelling, crafts and a costume parade.

Creepy Tours

Ghosts of New York Tours
Various dates and times
Though the history of New York isn’t as old as that of grand cities in the old continent, it’s no less fascinating. October is the perfect time to book a Ghosts of New York Tour that will take you through Manhattan’s historic neighborhoods, and you’ll learn about Edgar Allan Poe and his ties to New York. Other available tours are Ghosts of Grand Central and Ghosts of the Museum of Natural History.

Crypt Crawl: Spotlight on Halloween
October 26, 2018 from 4pm to 5pm
This Halloween, the Cathedral Church of Saint John The Divine will lure visitors to its walls by organizing a guided tour about the history of All Hallows Eve… And of the cathedral’s crypts! Explore the underground tombs, hear chilling stories about their inhabitants and, hopefully, live to tell the tale…

Are you planning on a long holiday this fall? Apart from the above mentioned events, we have a great list of things to do in New York this fall. Check out the New Yorker Hotel deals and book your room today.
title: Halloween Events in New York City
